meanings.definition: Dybbukim: plural form of dybbuk, a malicious possessing spirit in Jewish folklore.
meanings.sent1: The village was haunted by dybbukim, causing fear among the residents.
meanings.sent2: The dybbukim were said to enter the bodies of unsuspecting victims.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous dybbukim played pranks on the townspeople, much to their annoyance.
meanings.sent4: The dybbukim were like invisible shadows, lurking in the corners of the old synagogue.
meanings.sent5: The legend of the dybbukim spread throughout the region, captivating all who heard it.
